Description: Plaque as amulet. A roughly rectangular plaque with rounded ends in translucent dark-blue glass having in high relief the standard of the Abydos nome. The back is flat.
Curator's comments: Curiously, in the Late Period, Long after Abydos had lost her distinction as the city of the dead, her nome standard became relatively frequent as an amulet. The lower part of the plaque is lost. Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (1994): fig.66
